unnormalised: Firstly, consider the major players. IndiGo, for example, boasts a substantial market share. Its on-time performance (OTP) frequently tops the charts, often exceeding 85% even amidst peak season traffic. Booking flights directly through their website or via intermediaries like MakeMyTrip often presents competitive pricing. Keep an eye out for flash sales offering discounts up to 15% on select routes.

unnormalised: Air India, now under Tata Group ownership, is undergoing a significant transformation. Expect improvements in customer service, fleet modernization, and route expansions. Their loyalty program, Flying Returns, offers lucrative benefits for frequent flyers. Monitor their promotional campaigns, especially around festivals like Diwali and Holi, for substantial discounts on both domestic and international routes. Check their baggage allowance, often 25 kg for economy class, to avoid unexpected excess baggage fees.

They frequently offer upgrade options at the airport, sometimes at a cost of Rs. 3000-5000 depending on availability.
